DataElement.preferredName: Prostate Specific Antigen Measurement Value Clinical Study Protocol Criterion Met Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine whether or not the numerical quantity measured of the prostate specific antigen present in a sample satisfies the requirements of the criteria outlined in a clinical study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prostate Specific Antigen Measurement Value Clinical Study Protocol Criterion Fulfill
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The determination of the prostate specific antigen present in a sample._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed._A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the trial, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents._That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison._Satisfy the requirements or expectations of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The determination of the prostate specific antigen present in a sample

Concepts.definition: The determination of the prostate specific antigen present in a sample.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.
Satisfy the requirements or expectations of.
